title.narrative: Peace and Community Cohesion project, South Sudan, 2017-2020
Peace and Community Cohesion project, South Sudan, 2017-2020

description.narrative: Intended outcome of the intervention is Peace and governance strengthened, Relationships improved between divided communities and policy frameworks and institutional mechanisms enabled for peaceful and inclusive management of emerging and recurring conflicts and tensions.

South Sudan has been characterized by conflict since December 2013, which has intensified and proliferated especially since July 2016. The country is defined by a humanitarian crisis and major refugee flows. In this difficult environment, the Peace and Community Cohesion project (PaCC) seeks to contribute to the reduction and mitigation of community level conflict and insecurity by investing in initiatives that address key drivers of conflict and insecurity. The project will empower communities to identify in an inclusive and participatory manner, the drivers of conflicts in their communities, and using an integrated and gender sensitive approach taking into account the different needs of women, men, girls and boys. It is assumed that effectively preventing, managing and resolving conflicts in a non-violent manner will strengthen community relationships, by identifying and strengthening cultural, social and economic connectors that make communities reliant on each other in times of peace and conflict, across sex and age divide. This will in turn contribute to strengthened peace and governance.

Sydsudan präglas sedan december 2013 av konflikt som särskilt sedan juli 2016 ökat i intensitet och spridning. Landet genomsyras av humanitär kris och stora flyktingströmmar. Projektet Peace and Community Cohesion (PaCC) ämnar att i denna svåra miljö bidra till att reducera konflikter och säkerhetsrisker på lokalsamhällesnivå, genom att investera i initiativ som berör grundorsaker till våldsam konflikt. Projektet kommer att stärka lokalsamhällen att identifiera orsaker och faktorer som driver på konflikter i samhället, genom en inkluderande, deltagande och integrerad ansats som tar hänsyn till jämställdhet och kvinnors, mäns, flickors och pojkars olika behov. Genom att effektivt förebygga, hantera och lösa konflikter på ett icke-våldsamt sätt antas att relationer i lokalsamhällena kommer att stärkas. Projektet kommer att ge stöd i att identifiera och stärka kulturella, sociala och ekonomiska förbindelser (connectors) som bidrar till ökat samarbete och förtroende, under tider av fred och konflikt, och över gränser såsom kön och ålder. Insatsen ska bidra till det mer övergripande målet om stärkta förutsättningar för fred och god samhällsstyrning på nationell och lokal nivå.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: With regard to impact, the contribution had by the end of 2019 led to the majority (58.2%) of the people in the five conflict clusters where UNDP operates feeling increased levels of safety and security, which was above target. 66.4% of the community members in the conflict clusters perceived that intercommunal conflict and violence had decreased since the start of the project in 2017. Another example of impact is that the women economic empowerment groups formed within the project had increased women's confidence to also engage in community peacebuilding activities and health awarenesss campaigns. According to the external Summative Evaluation of January 2020, the project was effective in increasing local-level social cohesion in the five conflict clusters- Furthemore, the dialogue mechansisms were effective in reducing the risk of inter-communal violence and efforts were made in creating local conflict-management mechanisms needed for mitigating the risk of future conflicts.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
